title.rendered: San Antonio AC Repair Near Me: When Is It Time to Replace My Air Conditioner?

content.rendered:
Not sure whether to call a San Antonio AC repair near me to replace the unit just yet? Well, it really depends on the current condition of your air conditioner and how old it is. If your AC is 10 or more years old, and it keeps breaking down, you need to ask yourself whether it would cost less to repair it or replace the whole thing. To figure out when it would be best to replace your air conditioner, consider the following factors. 

Has It Been 10+ Years Since The AC Unit Was Installed?

As much as you’d like otherwise, air conditioners are not built to last forever. If your AC unit is nearing 15 years, it is definitely going to display a lot of issues that can lead to costly repairs. As these problems start to occur with alarming frequency, it might be more economical for you to buy a new system.

One of the biggest signs of a failing air conditioner is when you need to call a San Antonio ac repair near me for major repairs just 1 year after you last had it serviced. If you spent several hundred dollars just last summer to tune up the AC, and it looks like it’s already breaking down, odds are this will continue to happen every year.

Does Your AC Use R-22 Refrigerant? 

If your San Antonio ac repair tells you (after an inspection) that the refrigerant needs to be replaced, it’s usually due to a coolant leak. In almost all the older models, R-22 (Freon) used to be the refrigerant. However, now R-22 is being phased out by the government as well as the manufacturers because of its extremely high emission levels.

If your AC was installed in the late 2000s, it most definitely uses Freon. And if it needs to be refilled, it’s going to cost you a small fortune these days. Your best option, in this case, is to replace the system and buy a modern unit that’s environmentally friendly.

Are Your Cooling Bills Getting Steeper?

Weather patterns change each year, so it’s natural that your cooling and heating bills will also fluctuate. However, if you notice an incredible spike in your energy bills seemingly out of nowhere, that’s a problem.

For example, if the difference between April and June is a $20-$30 or more jump in your utility bill (as opposed to a $5 increase between spring and summer that’s the norm), it’s likely that your air conditioner is consuming too much energy.

Some of the components inside your AC unit might be failing and struggling to perform their most basic functions. Call San Antonio ac repair to have the system checked out. If you’ve already spent a lot on the unit’s upkeep within the last couple of years, it might be time to say goodbye to it.

Contact San Antonio AC Repair Near Me For Free Estimation

If you’re still not sure whether you truly need to replace the system, give us a call. Our technicians will perform a thorough evaluation, and if they think repairing the AC might be a more financially sound decision for you, that’s what they will suggest.

United Home Services has been in the business for over 22 years, and we are dedicated to serving you in a way that brings you lasting happiness and satisfaction. Call us at 866-847-7454 or contact us online to schedule an AC inspection today.
